title.narrative: strengthening the Ciudad Vieja Integrated Employment Center

description.narrative: Centro de Promocin por la Dignidad Humana (CEPRODIH). CEPRODIH will help a network of women micro-entrepreneurs become self-sufficient by opening a store to be owned and operated by the Club de Emprededoras and train another 100 men and women in the skills necessary to the success of their businesses. Another 300 will benefit indirectly.

participating-org.narrative: Centro de Promocin por la Dignidad Humana

receiver-org.narrative: Centro de Promocin por la Dignidad Humana

title.narrative: Education/Training Grant

description.narrative: Through this planning grant, Organizacin Social Salvador (OSS) will work in approximately four departments of Uruguay in strengthening existing Afro- descendant organizations and formalizing Afro- descendant community groups. OSS expects to formalize and strengthen at least eight existing Afro- descendent groups and offer them the capacity to access government grants targeted to Afro- descendent groups.

title.narrative: Education/Training Grant

description.narrative: Centro de Estudios e Investigaciones Afro-Mundo Afro Organizaciones and its partners, including former IAF grantee Fundacin Defensores del Chaco of Argentina, will use sports leagues and educational and cultural activities to further civic participation and tolerance among marginalized young Afro-Uruguayans in larger cities of Uruguay. The program includes outdoor events and performances by neighborhood musicians, dancers and actors. The work will benefit 2,500 young Afro-Uruguayans directly and another 8,000 indirectly.

participating-org.narrative: Centro de Estudios e Investigaciones Afro-Mundo Afro Organizaciones

receiver-org.narrative: Centro de Estudios e Investigaciones Afro-Mundo Afro Organizaciones

title.narrative: Resource mobilization for local development base in Cologne, Uruguay, through institutional strengthening of the region Colonia Fund.

description.narrative: Communities in Colonia lack sufficient resources to secure needed development funding. Asociacin Civil Fondo Regin Colonia (FRC) mobilizes local resources and provides grants for projects that encourage community participation and exchanges among local organizations and mobilize local national and international resources from the public and private sectors. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to unlock private public and community resources for grassroots development in Uruguay. FRC's activities strengthen grassroots organizations through education and training and build peer-to-peer learning and action networks. This grant is part of our broader initiative to encourage innovative and entrepreneurial thinking to expand local resources for grassroots development.

title.narrative: Resource mobilization for local development base in Cologne, Uruguay, through institutional strengthening of the region Colonia Fund.

description.narrative: Communities in Colonia lack sufficient resources to secure needed development funding. Asociacin Civil Fondo Regin Colonia (FRC) mobilizes local resources and provides grants for projects that encourage community participation and exchanges among local organizations and mobilize local, national, and international resources from the public and private sectors. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to unlock private, public, and community resources for grassroots development in Uruguay. FRC's activities strengthen grassroots organizations through education and training and build peer-to-peer learning and action networks. This grant is part of our broader initiative to encourage innovative and entrepreneurial thinking to expand local resources for grassroots development.

title.narrative: Collective Action

description.narrative: The Movimiento 24 de Diciembre (M24D) will strengthen community organization in five areas vulnerable to flood and sewage overflow in the city of Paysand. These low-income neighborhoods will develop strategic planning and enhance their management capacity in order to improve their participation in the dialogues about access to decent housing neighborhood improvements and a healthy environment. The project will benefit 280 people directly and another 6000 indirectly.

title.narrative: Casa Veneguaya (CV)

description.narrative: Venezuelan migrants in Uruguay face a number of challenges including access to employment, housing, health services, and education. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to creating social and economic inclusion opportunities for Venezuelan migrants. Manos VeneGuayas (MV) provides training and technical assistance to Venezuelan migrants in employability and entrepreneurship. By partnering with other migrant support organizations, international organizations, and national private and public sectors, MV amplifies their impact and promotes the sustainability of their work. This is part of the IAFs regional initiative to respond to the Venezuela migration crisis in Latin America and the Caribbean.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Conectad's Uruguay's y Venezolan's CPUED crecer, an en pandemia

description.narrative: Venezuelan migrants in Uruguay face a number of challenges in adapting to their new communities: accessing services, exercising their rights, and finding gainful employment. Many suffer from psychosocial issues from the traumas they experienced in Venezuela and on their journey to Uruguay. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to creating economic opportunity and promoting social inclusion for Venezuelan migrants. Construyendo Puentes Dignos (CPUED) provides training and technical assistance in employment and entrepreneurship, promotes social integration, and facilitates access to education, health, and psychosocial services. This is part of the IAFs regional initiative to respond to the Venezuela migration crisis in Latin America and the Caribbean.

title.narrative: Improve the quality of life and support the craftsmanship of women in the interior of the country

description.narrative: Women living in rural parts of Uruguay have limited economic opportunities. The IAF supports sustainable livelihood development for people in rural areas. Our grantee Manos del Uruguay (Manos) works with 12 cooperatives of women artisans from various communities in Uruguay to increase their employment opportunities and incomes. Manos and the cooperatives are incorporating new members and supporting them with training and technical assistance to improve their productivity. Manos is also updating its own management and logistics systems, establishing new commercial contacts, and promoting its brand nationally and internationally, in order to be able to sell more of the artisans' products.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Mejorar la calidad de vida y sostener el trabajo artesanal de las mujeres del interior del pas

description.narrative: Women living in rural parts of Uruguay have limited economic opportunities. The IAF supports sustainable livelihood development for people in rural areas. Our grantee Manos del Uruguay (Manos) works with 12 cooperatives of women artisans from various communities in Uruguay to increase their employment opportunities and incomes. Manos and the cooperatives are incorporating new members and supporting them with training and technical assistance to improve their productivity. Manos is also updating its own management and logistics systems, establishing new commercial contacts, and promoting its brand nationally and internationally, in order to be able to sell more of the artisans products.

title.narrative: Haciendo visible la violencia por orientacin sexual e identidad de gnero en Latinoamrica .

description.narrative: The discrimination and human rights violations experienced by members of the LGBTQ+ community throughout Central America are not well documented or analyzed. This lack of data limits the effectiveness of policies and mechanisms designed to protect human rights and safety. The IAF supports community-led efforts to protect human rights and promote inclusion through improved data collection. Our grantee Asociacin Iniciativa Latinoamericana por los Datos Abiertos (ILDA) will partner with five Central American-based LGBTQ+-led organizations to enhance their ability to gather data regarding acts of discrimination and hate crimes, and support them in analyzing the data at the country and regional level. ILDA and the local organizations will develop communications strategies to share this information widely among the general public as well as among national and regional-level policy makers to ensure more efficient and effective rights and safety protection measures.

participating-org.narrative: Iniciativa Latinoamericana por los Datos Abiertos

title.narrative: NGO Training Program on Local Development

description.narrative: CLAEH LA-154 Centro Latinoamericano de Economa Humana (CLAEH) $112,400 to provide hands-on training to local participants on tested and proven methodologies of local public-private partnership work at the request of non- governmental organizations (NGOs) working at the local level in three of the following countries, El Salvador, Mexico, Paraguay, or Peru.

participating-org.narrative: Centro Latinoamericano de la Economa Humana

Centro Latinoamericano de la Economa Humana

title.narrative: Rural Women Working Toward the Exportation of Artisan Foods: An Expression of Uruguayan Culture

description.narrative: Delicias Criollas will develop 13 affiliated enterprises managed and supplied by 150 low- income rural women in 10 Uruguayan departments through training and technical assistance in the production of traditional foods, quality control and marketing. The women will benefit from increased income and some 3,750 other individuals will benefit indirectly from the project. (UR-181)

title.narrative: Participation, debate and action

description.narrative: ADP-CES will improve the technical skills and income of 400 farmers throughout the department of Paysand. It will also encourage their participation in mesas zonales, similar to neighborhood boards that bring together some 4,000 residents of six communities to identify their priorities and develop projects for funding. ADP-CES will also attend the Ecovida Network conference on the organic certification and marketing of agricultural products in Florianpolis, Brazil. The event is expected to culminate in the formation of a Latin America network to facilitate the exchange of information toward more effective practices.

participating-org.narrative: Agencia de Desarrollo Productivo-Consejo Econmico Social

title.narrative: Strengthenin g the Ciudad Vieja Integrated Employment Center

description.narrative: CEPRODIH will support the creation of a support network to mentor 460 women entrepreneurs as they launch or develop businesses and to help them develop marketing opportunities. Through CEPRODIH's business incubator and training center, the women will receive training and technical assistance. (UR-185)

title.narrative: Strengthening the participation of the Afrodescendant Community in Uruguay

description.narrative: Organizacin Social Salvador (OSS), $49,200 over one year. Through this planning grant, Organizacin Social Salvador (OSS) will work in approximately four departments of Uruguay in strengthening existing Afro-descendant organizations and formalizing Afro- descendant community groups. OSS expects to formalize and strengthen at least eight existing Afro-descendent groups and offer them the capacity to access government grants targeted to Afro- descendent groups.

title.narrative: Street Football: A sport and educational tool for youth and adolescents values

description.narrative: Centro de Estudios e Investigaciones Afro- Mundo Afro Organizaciones (Mundo Afro) and its partners, including former IAF grantee Fundacin Defensores del Chaco of Argentina, will use sports leagues and educational and cultural activities to further civic participation and tolerance among marginalized young Afro-Uruguayans in larger cities of Uruguay. The program includes outdoor events and performances by neighborhood musicians, dancers and actors. The work will benefit 2,500 young Afro-Uruguayans directly and another 8,000 indirectly.

title.narrative: Resource mobilization for local development base in Cologne, Uruguay, through institutional Strengthening of the region Colonia Fund.

description.narrative: Asociacin Civil Fondo Regin Colonia (FRC), Uruguay's first community foundation, will provide grants for development projects in the Colonia Department, promote a culture of philanthropy, encourage community participation and organize exchanges among local organizations. The grantee will also coordinate with the public and private sectors to mobilize local, national and international resources. This project will benefit 3,000 people directly and 15,000 indirectly.
